column4: I know to remove all the tags we do   sed 's/<[^>]*>//g  ..   What if I had two characters following ^(not) ?  [^ab] would be OR.. how to do Negate+And

that's very tricky. Two strategies: Use a regex engine that supports non-greedy matching (you could use perl as a filter), convert the multi-byte patterns to single characters (after escaping those single characters), then use your original approach on that and undo the escaping. Also, there's channels like ##sed, #regex, #perl, etc.
And: For handling data like xml and html, there often are better ways.
